title: How to Make Goo Slices

steps.headline: Line a 20 centimeter (7.9 in) square cake pan with a double layer of cling wrap.
steps.description: Make sure it covers the sides.

steps.headline: Cover the base of the pan with 9 'Lattice Biscuits'.
Pour the cream, milk, and pudding mixture into a bowl.
Beat with an electric mixer on medium speed.
steps.description: Do this until the mixture is thick.

steps.headline: Drop in 3-4 drops of green food coloring.
Spread the mix over the biscuits evenly.
Refrigerate overnight.
steps.description: This will allow the filling to set, and the biscuits to slightly soften.

steps.headline: Remove the biscuits from the fridge.
Take the biscuits out of the pan, and cut up into squares to serve.

text: Line a 20 centimeter (7.9 in) square cake pan with a double layer of cling wrap. Make sure it covers the sides. Cover the base of the pan with 9 'Lattice Biscuits'. This is one single layer. Pour the cream, milk, and pudding mixture into a bowl.  Beat with an electric mixer on medium speed. Do this until the mixture is thick. Drop in 3-4 drops of green food coloring.  Spread the mix over the biscuits evenly.  Top with 9 more 'Lattice Biscuits'.  Cover loosely with cling wrap.  Refrigerate overnight. This will allow the filling to set, and the biscuits to slightly soften. Remove the biscuits from the fridge.  Take the biscuits out of the pan, and cut up into squares to serve.
